channel.title: Is this a scam?
channel.description: I'm trying to figure something out, are the free ringtones that send the code thru text messaging scams? b/c all the ringers on my phone suck ass. so does anyone know?

item.title: Is this a scam?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

They say free and then charge you per month. just download them from torrents to your computer to your phone for free.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a scam?
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

Yes, the texts are nearly always scams.

I Br3ndan I:

Most of the offers I’ve accepted similar to this have been scams. What they do is send you the tone, but extract a certain amount of £/$ from your phone weekly/monthly. The only thing you can do is get a new SIM card.

You can stop most by texting back stop or something along those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a scam?
item.dc:creator: @sidishere sidishere
item.description:
@sidishere wrote:

most of them are scams my advice:
download a mp3 file from limewire or whatever transfer it to your phone and set it as your ringtone. easy, free and safe!

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a scam?
item.dc:creator: @Ii_1337_iI Ii 1337 iI
item.description:
@Ii_1337_iI wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:2, topic:163176”]Well, they are free, but your paying the internet costs to download them, so by the time you’ve downloaded them, you’ve lost £5 credit, £1 of witch goes to whoever you downloaded it from.[/quote]hmm… well owell. my dad turned off the internet after i tried playing rs on his phone for 5 minutes his bill was over 100$ for those few minutes sprint can kiss my ass.

Read full topic
